name: Northern Headlands
economy_niches: transshipment of imported ritual reagents; small ritual workshops
culture_adjustments: more insular and wary of inland merchants
heightened professional status for pilots and reef-navigators
families often led by captain-matriarchs or kin-networks broken by sea loss
local rites focus on cliff-saints, beacons and wreck-memorials
conservative Coastal Tongues vocabulary for currents and charts
constraints: ritual reagent imports subject to coastal tariffs and inspection
notes: navigational auguries supplement but do not replace local piloting
no large sheltered harbors â€” limits heavy ship construction
fortified beacons serve as community, religious and signaling hubs
